item.ptxt: Confirm the sheet thickness, tensile strength, and existence of the zinc treatment of both sides, and set the welder to conform to the welding conditions by referring to Roof and Side Panel Construction, and Floor and Rear Body Construction.
Welding symbols (The welding symbols with dashed lines have a meaning of the spot welding of the part which is not visible)

s1.ptxt: Clamp the new rear pillar lower gutter, rough-cut the rear side outer panel repair part, and clamp it to the body.
Check the body dimensions:

ptxt.sie-ref04: Rear pillar gutter and rear panel positions

s1.ptxt: Because the adhesive between the outer panel (A) and the rear inner panel (B) may burn when welding the outer panel, scrape out the sealer (C) between the outer panel and the rear inner panel with a pick tool (D).
Grinding for better adhesive adherence:

item.ptxt: Grind the wheel arch portion of the rear inner panel (A) and the outer panel repair part (B) with a belt sander using sand paper.
Air blow the grinding surfaces, then degrease with a wax and grease remover.

s1.ptxt: Put the cartridge in a caulking gun, and run a continuous bead of the adhesive (A) on the rear inner panel (B) and the outer panel repair part (C).
NOTE: Use care to make sure the adhesive is not applied in areas that will be butt welded when the outer panel is installed.
Adhesive: 3M AUTO MIX Panel Bonding , or equivalent, commercially available
NOTE: See the adhesive manufacturer's instructions for details.
Even out the applied adhesive (A) with a spatula (B).
NOTE:

item.ptxt: Use care to make sure the adhesive is not applied in areas that will be butt welded when the outer panel is installed.
Be careful not to entrap air in adhesive.

s1.ptxt: Body side: Reapply the adhesive (A) on the rear inner panel (B).
NOTE: Use care to make sure the adhesive is not applied in areas that will be butt welded when the outer panel is installed.
Apply the sealer (A) to the fuel fill door adapter mating surface of the rear inner panel (B) and the outer panel mating surface of the lower gutter (C).
Install the new wheel arch outer separator (A) on the rear inner panel (B).Apply the sealer (C) without gaps all the way around the separator and inside the outer panel repair part (D).
Clamp the outer panel repair part, and recheck the clearance and alignment of the rear door and the tailgate.
NOTE: Never touch the adhesive surfaces with your hands.
Make a gap evenly with the rear inner panel (A) mm ( in) while pushing the wheel arch portion of the outer panel repair part (B). Weld the rear of the adhesive range.
NOTE: Use a commercially available adhesive remover to remove any excess adhesive.
Do the main welding.Weld the outer panel repair part (A) and the rear pillar lower gutter (B).
Apply the sealer (A) to the gap between the outer panel (B) and the rear inner panel (C) beside the butt welding area of the rear wheel arch.
Drying adhesive.
NOTE: Do not move the body until the adhesive is dry.
